column4: Hello everyone, Linux infant here. Setting up a basic home server (media streaming/sharing, etc), would Ubuntu Desktop be a more suitable server enviornment to me than the Ubuntu Server considering my very limited experience?
most likely, although server will last longer.
release cycle. The desktop is fine plus it comes with a gu.
yes, although there are other options.
are any alternatives to SCP or SFTP better for these purposes?
I have used ssh/scp with sshfs which makes a remote hard drive look like a local one.
You might want to google 'ubuntu media server'
How will people be accessing the files?

There are basically 4 or so windows computers on the network, I have a 5th computer with ubuntu installed and want it to act as a home server so that the windwos computers can stream media/music off of it, store (hopefully incremental) backups and other files, among other home server functions...
There is samba, which lets you share a drive as on a windows network.
right, I just installed it, and like i said above, it opens up, asks for a password, I enter it, and it goes away
is it possible that samba is bugged on 10.10?
what do you mean? It should just start the samba service and then other computers can access your computer.
what is the windows computer error?
windows cannot access \\Server\share --- check the spelling of the name...blahblah...
If you haven't configured it yet, you might not have a directory available.
I'll read up and look at it
